properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 11:33AM EST until February 6 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in BLACKSBURG has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Tazewell County in southwestern Virginia...

* Until 730 PM EST Thursday

* At 1128 AM EST, emergency management reported significant flooding
ongoing due to heavy rain across the warned area. Up to three
inches of rain have already fallen with rainfall continuing. Flash
and additional river flooding will continue and likely worsten
over the next few hours. The Clinch River is already above flood
stage, and is expected to crest around 15 feet. This would be the
highest river level witnessed in over 40 years, dating back to
1978. A Local Emergency has been declared and evacuations in
vicinity of the Clinch River may be needed shortly. Shelters are
being opened around the county in preparation.

This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Tazewell County, especially in
areas along the Clinch River. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS
SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
properties.instruction:
Move to higher ground now. This is an extremely dangerous and
life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are
fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, country roads, farmland, and other low lying
spots.

When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding,
including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service
by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and
pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service
Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

NWSheadline: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR TAZEWELL COUNTY. SIGNIFICANT FLOODING ONGOING, SHELTERS OPENING, EVACUATIONS MAY BEGIN SHORTLY ALONG THE CLINCH RIVER WHICH MAY REACH HEIGHTS NOT SEEN IN OVER 40 YEARS
CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 7:30 PM EST. Avoid flooded areas.
